paper_abstract: The Randic index R(G) of a graph G is the sum of weights (deg(u) deg(v))(-0.5) over all edges an of C, where deg(v) denotes the degree of a vertex v. We prove that for any tree T with n(1) leaves R(T) >= ad(T) + max(0,root n(1) - 2), where ad(T) is the average distance between vertices of T. As a consequence we resolve the conjecture R(G) >= ad(G) given by Fajtlowicz in 1988 for the case when G is a tree.
paper_title: Relation Between Randic Index and Average Distance of Trees
